# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code for your function `clean_column`. 

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ -]" => "_")
end
```
This function takes a string (`col`) as an input and returns another string which is the cleaned version of the input column name. 
The `replace` function replaces all occurrences of a given regular expression with a replacement string in the original string. The `lowercase` function converts all upper case letters to lower case. The `strip` function removes leading and trailing whitespaces from a string. The regular expression r"[ -]" matches any space or hyphen character.
